name: DirectionHelper
description: The DirectionHelper class provides a wrapper around Minecraft's Direction enum, offering various methods to work with cardinal directions and orientations in the game world. This class is commonly used when working with player movement, block interactions, and spatial calculations.
overview:
DirectionHelper represents one of the six possible directions in Minecraft: North, South, East, West, Up, and Down. It provides utilities for direction manipulation, rotation, and conversion between different coordinate systems.

## How to Obtain DirectionHelper

DirectionHelper instances are typically obtained through various methods in JSMacros:

```javascript
// From player entity
const facing = player.getFacingDirection(); // Returns DirectionHelper

// From block state properties
const blockState = world.getBlock(x, y, z).getBlockState();
const horizontalFacing = blockState.getHorizontalFacing(); // Returns DirectionHelper

// From hit result (when looking at blocks)
const hitResult = player.getHitResult();
const side = hitResult.getSide(); // Returns DirectionHelper
```

## Available Directions

The six cardinal directions in Minecraft:
- **NORTH** (-Z direction)
- **SOUTH** (+Z direction)
- **EAST** (+X direction)
- **WEST** (-X direction)
- **UP** (+Y direction)
- **DOWN** (-Y direction)

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Gets the textual name of the direction (e.g., "north", "south", "east", "west", "up", "down").
examples:
const direction = player.getFacingDirection();
const name = direction.getName(); // "north", "south", etc.

methods.name: getAxis
methods.description: Returns "x", "y", or "z" depending on which axis the direction operates on.
examples:
const direction = player.getFacingDirection();
const axis = direction.getAxis(); // "x", "y", or "z"

methods.name: isVertical
methods.description: Checks if the direction is pointing up or down.

methods.name: isHorizontal
methods.description: Checks if the direction is pointing north, south, east, or west.

methods.name: isTowardsPositive
methods.description: Positive directions are: EAST (+X), UP (+Y), SOUTH (+Z).

methods.name: getYaw
methods.description:
Returns the horizontal rotation angle corresponding to this direction:
- SOUTH: 0°
- WEST: 90°
- NORTH: 180°
- EAST: 270°
- UP/DOWN: 0°
examples:
const direction = player.getFacingDirection();
const yaw = direction.getYaw(); // 0, 90, 180, or 270

methods.name: getPitch
methods.description:
Returns the vertical rotation angle:
- Horizontal directions: 0°
- UP: -90°
- DOWN: 90°
examples:
const direction = player.getFacingDirection();
const pitch = direction.getPitch(); // 0, 90, or -90

methods.name: getOpposite
methods.description:
Returns a new DirectionHelper instance pointing in the opposite direction:
- NORTH ↔ SOUTH
- EAST ↔ WEST
- UP ↔ DOWN

methods.name: getLeft
methods.description: Returns a new DirectionHelper instance pointing 90° counter-clockwise from the current direction (when viewed from above).

methods.name: getRight
methods.description: Returns a new DirectionHelper instance pointing 90° clockwise from the current direction (when viewed from above).

methods.name: getVector
methods.description: Returns a Pos3D object representing the direction as a unit vector with values of -1, 0, or 1 for each axis.

methods.name: pointsTo
methods.description: Determines if a given yaw angle is closest to this direction.

parameters.name: yaw
parameters.description: The yaw angle in degrees to check

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a formatted string containing the direction's name, yaw, and pitch.
examples:
const direction = player.getFacingDirection();
const info = direction.toString(); // e.g., 'DirectionHelper:{"name": "north", "yaw": 180.000000, "pitch": 0.000000}'

methods.name: getRaw
methods.description: Provides access to the raw Minecraft Direction object if needed for advanced use cases.
examples:
const direction = player.getFacingDirection();
const rawDirection = direction.getRaw(); // Access to the raw Direction enum

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Compares this DirectionHelper with another object for equality.
